H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H2711.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H962.def: = action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4801.def: = state in which humans, deities, objects, or events are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H575.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H1115.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H3766.def: = process by which humans or animals sink on their knees ◄ as a result of being unable to keep standing up

H616.def: usually used as collective: = person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2195.def: = action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H2611.def: = state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

H962.def: = action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

H957.def: = all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4823.def: = action by which humans or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H1819.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H8045.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3751.def: = town; ◄ on the {L:Euphrates<SDBH:פְּרָת>}; ► location where {L:Nebuchadnezzar<SDBH:נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר>} defeated the {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>} and the {L:Egyptians<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}

H2574.def: = town, area; ◄ on Orontes river in {L:Syria<SDBH:אֲרָם>}; ► capital of {L:Aramean<SDBH:אֲרַמִּי>} kingdom; its inhabitants were relocated to {L:Samaria<SDBH:שֹׁמְרֹון>} by the king of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H1834.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Syria<SDBH:אֲרָם>}; ► capital of one of the {L:Aramaean<SDBH:אֲרָם>} kingdoms

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H457.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ usually made from stone or wood overlaid with gold or silver; ► functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship; ≈ associated with being worthless and useless

H4467.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H6456.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H457.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ usually made from stone or wood overlaid with gold or silver; ► functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship; ≈ associated with being worthless and useless

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H6091.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1214.def: = causative action by which someone severs a link between one object and a larger object of which it used to be a part

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H1433.def: = state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1367.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H6264.def: = state in which someone is prepared for an event

H47.def: = male bovine; ≈ symbol of deities and associated with power and strength, but also with aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H7064.def: = structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H1000.def: = an oval or round object coming from the body of a female bird or reptile and containing an ovum which, if fertilized, can develop into a new organism; ≈ appreciated as food

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H5074.def: = action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

H6850.def: = action by which birds, but also, in a derogatory way, to ghosts and mediums produce high-pitched sounds

H1631.def: = wooden handle with an {L:iron<SDBH:בַּרְזֶל>} blade, sharpened on one face, parallel to the handle; ► used for cutting down trees and shaping wood or stone

H6286.def: = action by which humans check the branches of a tree after having beaten it; ► in order to find any remaining fruit

H2672.def: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4883.def: = a flat tool with a serrated edge, sometimes fitted with a handle, ◄ made of either hard stone, such as flint, or metal; ► used for cutting objects in two

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H5130.def: = action by which humans hold an object in their hands and move it to and fro, ► probably in order to signal to a deity that the object in their hands is intended for them

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H113.def: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H4924.def: literally: fat; hence: = state in which land is of an exceedingly good quality

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3350.def: = state in which a {L:fire<SDBH:אֵשׁ>} is burning up the combustible materials fueling it

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7898.def: = small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction

H8068.def: = a legendary rock or mineral, known for its hardness; ≈ associated with an inflexible mind

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H3759.def: = newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H4549.def: = process by which substances become soft, ◄ often as a result of  a higher temperature

H5263.def: exact meaning unknown; literally, possibly: to melt; hence: = state in which humans gradually lose their strength and pine away as a result of sickness

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H6413.def: = a group of people who were able to flee from danger

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H2344.def: = minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea-shore, river-beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3631.def: = literally: finishing; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans and objects to completely disappear from existance

H2782.def: literally: to sharpen one's tongue; hence: = action by which  humans or animals show aggression to someone else with sounds or in speech

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3617.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H2782.def: literally: to sharpen one's tongue; hence: = action by which  humans or animals show aggression to someone else with sounds or in speech

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H4213.def: = state in which objects are relatively few in number

H2195.def: = action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H8399.def: = process by which humans disappear from existence, ◄ usually in a violent way

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H7752.def: = strip of leather or length of cord fastened to a handle, ► used for beating a person or urging on an animal

H4347.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

H4080.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H6159.def: = a large black bird with a thick strong beak, and fairly short legs; it is highly intelligent and seems to enjoy flying; it eats almost anything, including grain, fruit, insects, lizards, frogs, eggs, nestlings, and the meat of dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ its black color is regarded as beautiful

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5448.def: = process by which humans suffer hardship, ◄ described as a heavy burden that one is forced to carry

H7926.def: = the upper part of the human body between the head and the chest; ≈ associated with heavy burdens, and, in a more figurative way, heave responsibilities

H5923.def: = bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

38.gl: to break > to bring to an end

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H4411.def: = a place where people spend the night

H1387.def: = town, possibly to be identified with {L:Gibeah<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}; ◄ territory of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; ► given to Levites; hometown of King {L:Saul<SDBH:שָׁאוּל>}

H7414.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H2729.def: = state/process by which inanimate objects shake or tremble violently

H1390.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H7586.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Kish<SDBH:קִישׁ>}; tribe of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; ► first king of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H5074.def: = action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H1374.def: = location; ◄ probably a few miles north of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>}

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H5130.def: = action by which humans hold an object in their hands and move it to and fro, ► probably in order to signal to a deity that the object in their hands is intended for them

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H113.def: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H4637.def: = an event that inspires an extreme fear in those who witness it

H1438.def: = process by which part of an object, without apparent human intervention, detaches itself from a larger unit, so that it falls to the ground

H1364.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H5362.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife, razor, or axe to remove part of a larger object

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H5442.def: = a dense growth of bushes or small trees that look intertwined; ► sometimes functions as a hiding place for animals

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H117.def: = pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status
